snippet: Prosecutors seeking to convict George Zimmerman in the death of Trayvon Martin scrambled to undo damage to their case by their own witnesses.
abstract: Prosecutors in second-degree murder trial of George Zimmerman scramble to undo damage to their case by one of their leading witnesses, Sanford police officer Chris Serino, who testified under cross-examination that Zimmerman seemed to be telling the truth when he said he had fired his gun at Trayvon Martin in self-defense.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors seeking to convict George Zimmerman in the death of Trayvon Martin scrambled to undo damage to their case by their own witnesses.

headline.main: State’s Witnesses in Zimmerman Trial Put the Prosecution on the Defensive
headline.print_headline: State’s Witnesses in Zimmerman Trial Put the Prosecution on the Defensive
